column4: Hey everyone. I don't actually use Ubuntu, but I'm trying to help my brother.  I've searched for upgrades and everything: but in Synaptic the latest version of Qt available is 4.1.2.  Any ideas why 4.3.x is not available? thanks
4.3 is available in Hardy
ok
It should be.  Pastebin your sources.list
http://rafb.net/p/kuE2w165.html
that looks normal enough.  do you get errors with 'sudo apt-get update'?
no errors
`sudo apt-get install build-essential` won't install it though?
sorry about that, lost internet
`sudo apt-get install build-essential` won't install it though?
dpkg -S g++
Again, does build-essential install?
`sudo apt-get install build-essential`  what does it tell you?
I guess you missed my response - I said it says that build-essential is already installed and up-to-date
and `apt-cache policy gcc` or `apt-cache policy g++` shows that its installed and all that good stuff, right?
It should, since you have it installed from b-e, `apt-cache policy g++` shows its installed, yes?
﻿apt-cache policy g++ shows it installed - yes
i tried doing as you said - Installed gcc and g++ 4.1, then I did export CXX=/usr/bin/g++-4.1, but now I get this error:﻿ http://rafb.net/p/V5Iv3923.html
try rmoving the -4.2 ones (with --purge, or "complete removal" in synaptic)
apt-get remove --purge gcc-4.2 gcc-4.2-base g++-4.2
can I just ignore this: http://rafb.net/p/TX79kA95.html

had to remove ﻿﻿gcc-base from the list of removals.  gcc-4.1 and g++-4.1 are deleted - yay. I closed the shell and reopened (to update the environment) but now g++ doesn't exist, do I need to manually create the symlinks?

reinstall build-essential, remove the -4.1 packages. That's what you should have if you install build-essential, so we'll go with that.  We'll try and figure out the original errors, since we're starting to stray from regular systems.
